title.narrative: Financial support for Internet Monitoring and Maintenance

description.narrative: The South Sudan Council of Churches (SSCC) has been implementing Action Plan for peace (APP) since the the development of APP through statement of intent which developed delivery of 4 programme outcome relating to advocacy, neutral forum, reconciliation, and institutional development. Through this church based nation wide and multi-stake engagement action, the SSCC envisage the realization of a peaceful resolution of conflicts and restoration of peace in South Sudan. The first phase of the the APP 2016-2017 has ended and SSCC is now implementing a new phase 2018-2021 through annual funding from all its partners including CTP, and Christian Aid, and PAX, all church Aid, working collaboratively under the structure core Group whose work is to mobile funding and provide technical support to SSCC in the implementation of APP South Sudan like many other countries is constrained unprecedentedly by social and economic systems breakdown because of COVID-19. Not only is the COVID-19 pandemic a threat to physical health and the economy. it has also restricted movement to project locations for monitoring visits and programme implementation. as SSCC scales up its operation in Greater Upper Nile Regions, the regional office demands infrastructural support (internet installation covering 1. Hardware and installation chargers 2. internet subscription for 12 months 3. transport cost 4. maintenance 5. Accommodation for technicians
